comments: From the von Staudt-Clausen theorem it follows that a(n) can be computed without using Bernoulli polynomials or the 'denominator'-function (see the Sage implementation). - _Peter Luschny_, Mar 24 2014
references: J. R. Philip, The symmetrical Euler-Maclaurin summation formula, Math. Sci., 6, 1981, pp. 35-41.

formula: a(n) = denominator(2*(2*Pi)^(-2*n)*(2*n)!*Li_{2*n}(-1)). - _Peter Luschny_, Jun 29 2012a(n) = A081294(n) * A002445(n) for n > 0. - _Paul Curtz_, Apr 17 2013
